item.title: Stochastic Convergence and Convergence Speed
item.description: Motivating Example Consider a simpel example of estimating the population mean with sample average. Let $ {X_i}^n_{i=1} $ denote a collection of i.i.d. random variables with distribution $P_0$. The population mean is denoted as $\mu:=\mathrm{E}_{P_0}(X_i)$ and the population variance is $\sigma^2$. A natural estimator for it is the sample average: $$ \bar{X}n = n^{-1}\sum{i=1}^n X_i $$ Now that we have an estimator for the parameter of interest, we want to know how good it is.
